title: So how much do placements matter anyway?
body: My mate said that even if you go 10/10 you still probs won't get placed much higher at all.

replies.body:
Your friend is not smart, 2 seasons ago i ended silver 2 and rage quit because oce server is the most awful place on earth
i came back last season and went 9-1, i hit plat 2, i later climbed to diamond (and then decayed to plat becase i had family matters)
So yes, the win loss does matter greatly, overall it just reflects your MMR where you get placed, winning lots = lots of mmr added to your brownie points, low mmr = lower rating.

i call bull%%%%.

even fresh account didnt go 10-0 and hit plat. i went 10-0 from bronze 1 season 3, to silver 5 season 2014. and i went 8-2 from a fresh account and got silver 2.

not to mention this season placements are worth A LOT less than ever before. riot have said it and tons of people have shown it to be true. gold 1-2s going 6-4 and getting silver 1. previous seasons they would still be gold even with 3-7.

If you go 10-0 you will most definitely get higher than your current rank. Its when you start throwing losses in there that the calculations get fuzzy. Going 9-1 is very different from 10-0 (apparently).

I've heard people going 7-3 and getting in a lower division then they ended last season in. People going 5-5 and getting higher. Theres just a lot of confusion since Riot would rather say Bronze 2 or Silver 3, instead of 1200 elo and 2000 elo etc... actual numbers so people can see the MMR changes.
somewhat, they affect where you're placed at the start. anyone that deserves to rise will.
Well if that's the case I might just not play ranked this season lol.
That seems to be how it is from all of the 'qq riot your placements are a joke' threads
